text:
The probabilities for a poor, normal, and good economy are unconditional probabilities.
The probabilities of rate increases are conditional probabilities (e.g., Prob (increase in
rates | poor economy) = 20%). The third column has joint probabilities (e.g., Prob (poor
economy and increase in rates) = 6%). The unconditional probability of a rate increase is
the sum of the joint probabilities, 6% + 20% + 14% = 40% = Prob (increase in rates).
